title: Recognizing Fish Poisoning Symptoms
brief: How to identify symptoms of fish toxin poisoning and understand the risks.
steps: Step 1: Watch for numbness of lips, tongue, toes, and fingertips after eating fish.
Step 2: Note any severe itching or unusual skin sensations.
Step 3: Check for temperature sensation reversal - cold items feeling hot and hot items feeling cold.
Step 4: Monitor for nausea, vomiting, and dizziness.
Step 5: Be alert for loss of speech or progressive paralysis.
Step 6: Seek immediate help if symptoms appear - paralysis can lead to death.
warnings: Fish toxins are water-soluble and cannot be neutralized by cooking.
Toxins are tasteless - standard edibility tests will not detect them.
Birds can eat poisonous fish safely - do not use bird consumption as a safety indicator.
Progressive paralysis from fish toxins can be fatal.
